appConfig.title: Ripple Design System
appConfig.subheader: Ripple is the design system for Victorian government digital products
appConfig.description: Make your service consistent with vic.gov.au digital branding. Learn from the research and experience of other service teams and avoid repeating work thatâ€™s already been done.

props.name: indexOf
props.description: Returns the index of the first occurrence of a value in an array.

tags.name: param
tags.text: searchElement The value to locate in the array.

tags.name: param
tags.text: fromIndex The array index at which to begin the search. If fromIndex is omitted, the search starts at index 0.

props.name: lastIndexOf
props.description: Returns the index of the last occurrence of a specified value in an array.

tags.name: param
tags.text: searchElement The value to locate in the array.

tags.name: param
tags.text: fromIndex The array index at which to begin the search. If fromIndex is omitted, the search starts at the last index in the array.

props.type: Prop<unknown, unknown> | ((searchElement: string, fromIndex?: number | undefined) => number) | ((searchElement: string, fromIndex?: number | undefined) => number) | ((searchElement: string, fromIndex?: number | undefined) => number) | null | undefined

tags.name: param

props.name: length
props.description: Gets the length of the array. This is a number one higher than the highest element defined in an array.

props.name: includes
props.description: Determines whether an array includes a certain element, returning true or false as appropriate.

tags.name: param
tags.text: searchElement The element to search for.

tags.name: param
tags.text: fromIndex The position in this array at which to begin searching for searchElement.

props.name: at
props.description: Returns the item located at the specified index.

tags.name: param
tags.text: index The zero-based index of the desired code unit. A negative index will count back from the last item.

props.type: Prop<unknown, unknown> | ((index: number) => string | undefined) | ((index: number) => string | undefined) | ((index: number) => string | undefined) | null | undefined

props.name: join
props.description: Adds all the elements of an array separated by the specified separator string.

tags.name: param
tags.text: separator A string used to separate one element of an array from the next in the resulting String. If omitted, the array elements are separated with a comma.

props.type: Prop<unknown, unknown> | ((separator?: string | undefined) => string) | ((separator?: string | undefined) => string) | ((separator?: string | undefined) => string) | null | undefined

schema.type: Prop<unknown, unknown> | ((separator?: string | undefined) => string) | ((separator?: string | undefined) => string) | ((separator?: string | undefined) => string) | null | undefined

props.name: every
props.description: Determines whether all the members of an array satisfy the specified test.

tags.name: param
tags.text:
predicate A function that accepts up to three arguments. The every method calls
the predicate function for each element in the array until the predicate returns a value
which is coercible to the Boolean value false, or until the end of the array.

tags.name: param
tags.text:
thisArg An object to which the this keyword can refer in the predicate function.
If thisArg is omitted, undefined is used as the this value.

thisArg An object to which the this keyword can refer in the predicate function.

which is coercible to the Boolean value true, or until the end of the array.

tags.text:
thisArg An object to which the this keyword can refer in the predicate function.

props.name: forEach
props.description: Performs the specified action for each element in an array.

props.name: reduce
props.description: Calls the specified callback function for all the elements in an array. The return value of the callback function is the accumulated result, and is provided as an argument in the next call to the callback function.

tags.name: param
tags.text: callbackfn A function that accepts up to four arguments. The reduce method calls the callbackfn function one time for each element in the array.

tags.name: param
tags.text: initialValue If initialValue is specified, it is used as the initial value to start the accumulation. The first call to the callbackfn function provides this value as an argument instead of an array value.

props.name: find
props.description:
Returns the value of the first element in the array where predicate is true, and undefined
otherwise.

tags.name: param
tags.text:
predicate find calls predicate once for each element of the array, in ascending
order, until it finds one where predicate returns true. If such an element is found, find
immediately returns that element value. Otherwise, find returns undefined.

tags.name: param
tags.text:
thisArg If provided, it will be used as the this value for each invocation of
predicate. If it is not provided, undefined is used instead.

props.type: Prop<unknown, unknown> | { <S extends string>(predicate: (value: string, index: number, obj: readonly string[]) => value is S, thisArg?: any): S | undefined; (predicate: (value: string, index: number, obj: readonly string[]) => unknown, thisArg?: any): string | undefined; } | { ...; } | { ...; } | null | undefined

schema.type: Prop<unknown, unknown> | { <S extends string>(predicate: (value: string, index: number, obj: readonly string[]) => value is S, thisArg?: any): S | undefined; (predicate: (value: string, index: number, obj: readonly string[]) => unknown, thisArg?: any): string | undefined; } | { ...; } | { ...; } | null | undefined

props.name: findIndex
props.description:
Returns the index of the first element in the array where predicate is true, and -1
otherwise.

tags.name: param
tags.text:
predicate find calls predicate once for each element of the array, in ascending
order, until it finds one where predicate returns true. If such an element is found,
findIndex immediately returns that element index. Otherwise, findIndex returns -1.

tags.name: param
tags.text:
thisArg If provided, it will be used as the this value for each invocation of
predicate. If it is not provided, undefined is used instead.

props.name: flatMap
props.description:
Calls a defined callback function on each element of an array. Then, flattens the result into
a new array.
This is identical to a map followed by flat with depth 1.

tags.name: param
tags.text:
callback A function that accepts up to three arguments. The flatMap method calls the
callback function one time for each element in the array.

tags.name: param
tags.text:
thisArg An object to which the this keyword can refer in the callback function. If
thisArg is omitted, undefined is used as the this value.

props.type: Prop<unknown, unknown> | (<U, This = undefined>(callback: (this: This, value: string, index: number, array: string[]) => U | readonly U[], thisArg?: This | undefined) => U[]) | (<U, This = undefined>(callback: (this: This, value: string, index: number, array: string[]) => U | readonly U[], thisArg?: This | undefined...

props.name: flat
props.description:
Returns a new array with all sub-array elements concatenated into it recursively up to the
specified depth.

tags.name: param
tags.text: depth The maximum recursion depth

props.name: findLast
props.description:
Returns the value of the last element in the array where predicate is true, and undefined
otherwise.

tags.name: param
tags.text:
predicate findLast calls predicate once for each element of the array, in descending
order, until it finds one where predicate returns true. If such an element is found, findLast
immediately returns that element value. Otherwise, findLast returns undefined.

tags.name: param
tags.text:
thisArg If provided, it will be used as the this value for each invocation of
predicate. If it is not provided, undefined is used instead.

props.type: Prop<unknown, unknown> | { <S extends string>(predicate: (value: string, index: number, array: readonly string[]) => value is S, thisArg?: any): S | undefined; (predicate: (value: string, index: number, array: readonly string[]) => unknown, thisArg?: any): string | undefined; } | { ...; } | { ...; } | null | undefined

props.name: findLastIndex
props.description:
Returns the index of the last element in the array where predicate is true, and -1
otherwise.

tags.name: param
tags.text:
predicate findLastIndex calls predicate once for each element of the array, in descending
order, until it finds one where predicate returns true. If such an element is found,
findLastIndex immediately returns that element index. Otherwise, findLastIndex returns -1.

tags.name: param
tags.text:
thisArg If provided, it will be used as the this value for each invocation of
predicate. If it is not provided, undefined is used instead.

props.name: toLocaleString
props.description:
Returns a date converted to a string using the current locale.
Returns a string representation of an array. The elements are converted to string using their toLocaleString methods.
